meanings.definition: The ability to be renewed or replenished.
meanings.sent1: The renewability of the soil allows farmers to plant new crops each season.
meanings.sent2: We should consider the renewability of our energy sources to protect the environment.
meanings.sent3: The party decorations had such renewability that they were used for multiple celebrations.
meanings.sent4: Her optimism had a renewability that inspired those around her to keep going.
meanings.sent5: The renewability of the forest after a wildfire was a testament to nature's resilience.

meanings.definition: The quality of being able to be used or sustained again.
meanings.sent1: The renewability of the water filter made it a cost-effective choice for the household.
meanings.sent2: When choosing materials for the project, we prioritized renewability to reduce waste.
meanings.sent3: The renewability of the toy made it a favorite among children who loved playing with it over and over.
meanings.sent4: His patience had a renewability that seemed endless, always willing to give others another chance.
meanings.sent5: The renewability of the batteries allowed the flashlight to be used multiple times without replacement.
